00040 #ifndef _sound_h
00041 #define _sound_h
00042 
00043 #include "datatypes.h"
00044 #include "vector3.h"
00045 
00046 namespace cAudio
00047 {
00048     class IAudioManager;
00049     class IAudioSource;
00050 }
00051 
00052 namespace phys
00053 {
00054     ///////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////
00055     /// @class Sound
00056     /// @headerfile sound.h
00057     /// @brief This is an instance of a sound that can be played and manipulated.
00058     /// @details This is a an instance of a sound that can be played, have effects
00059     /// applied to it, paused, stopped, triggered and other such crazyness.
00060     ///////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////
00061     class Sound
00062     {
00063         friend class SoundManager;
00064         protected:
00065             cAudio::IAudioSource* SoundSource;
00066             cAudio::IAudioManager* Manager;
00067         public:
00068             /// @brief Class Constructor.  Internal use only.
00069             /// @details The Class costructor.  Should not be called manually, use the sound manager instead.
00070             Sound();
00071             /// @brief Class Constructor.  Internal use only.
00072             /// @details The Class costructor.  Should not be called manually, use the sound manager instead.
00073             /// @param Source Pointer to the sound source.
00074             Sound(cAudio::IAudioSource* Source, cAudio::IAudioManager* manager);
00075             /// @brief Class destructor.
00076             /// @details The class destructor.
00077             ~Sound();
00078             /// @brief Plays the sound.
00079             /// @details Plays the sound with the same settings as the last time it was played.
00080             void Play();
00081             /// @brief Plays the sound in 2D mode.
00082             /// @details This will play the sound without altering it by it's position in 3D space.  Ideal
00083             /// for music and ambient sounds.
00084             /// @param Loop Whether or not the sound should restart once it's done playing.
00085             void Play2d(bool Loop=false);
00086             /// @brief Plays the sound in 3D mode.
00087             /// @details This will play the sound and alter it's properties based on it's location in 3D space.
00088             /// Sounds can sound like they are coming more from one direction then another, etc..
00089             /// @param Position The location in 3D space where the sound originates.
00090             /// @param SoundStrength The higher the sound strength, the further away you can hear the sound, not
00091             /// the same as volume.
00092             /// @param Loop Whether or not the sound should restart once it's done playing.
00093             void Play3d(Vector3 Position, Real SoundStrength=1.0, bool Loop=false);
00094             /// @brief Pauses the sound.
00095             /// @details Pauses the sound.
00096             void Pause();
00097             /// @brief Stops the sound.
00098             /// @details Stops the sound.
00099             void Stop();
00100             /// @brief Sets whether this sound should loop.
00101             /// @details Sets whether this sound should restart once it's done playing.
00102             /// @param ToLoop Whether or not this sound should restart
00103             void Loop(bool ToLoop);
00104             /// @brief Allows you to go to a specific point in the sound.
00105             /// @details This function will allow you to jump ahead or rewind to any specific
00106             /// point in the sound.
00107             /// @param Seconds How many seconds into the sound you want to jump to.
00108             /// @param Relative Whether or not you want the jump to be relative to where the sound
00109             /// is at the time of calling this function.
00110             void Seek(Real Seconds, bool Relative);
00111             /// @brief Gets the total size of the sound in seconds.
00112             /// @details This function will return the amount of seconds of the sound.
00113             /// @return Returns a Real that is the size in seconds.
00114             Real GetTotalAudioTime();
00115             /// @brief Gets the total size of the sound in memory.
00116             /// @details This function will return the total size of the sound in memory.
00117             /// @return Returns a Real that is the size in memory.
00118             int GetTotalAudioSize();
00119             /// @brief Gets the original compressed size of the sound.
00120             /// @details This function will return the compressed size of the sound.
00121             /// @return Returns a Real that is the original compressed size.
00122             int GetCompressedAudioSize();
00123             /// @brief Gets the current position in the audio stream in seconds.
00124             /// @details This function will get the current position of the sound in the audio stream.
00125             /// @return Returns the current position in the audio stream in seconds.
00126             Real GetCurrentAudioTime();
00127             /// @brief Gets the current position in the audio stream in bytes.
00128             /// @details This function will get the current position of the sound in the audio stream.
00129             /// @return Returns the current position in the audio stream in bytes.
00130             int GetCurrentAudioPosition();
00131             /// @brief Gets the current position in the original audio stream in bytes.
00132             /// @details This function will get the current position of the sound in the original audio stream.
00133             /// @return Returns the current position in the original audio stream in bytes.
00134             int GetCurrentCompressedAudioPosition();
00135             /// @brief Checks to see if the sound is currently playing.
00136             /// @details Checks to see if the sound is currently playing.
00137             /// @return Returns whether or not the sound is currently playing.
00138             bool IsPlaying();
00139             /// @brief Checks to see if the sound is currently paused.
00140             /// @details Checks to see if the sound is currently paused.
00141             /// @return Returns whether or not the sound is currently paused.
00142             bool IsPaused();
00143             /// @brief Checks to see if the sound is currently stopped.
00144             /// @details Checks to see if the sound is currently stopped.
00145             /// @return Returns whether or not the sound is currently stopped.
00146             bool IsStopped();
00147             /// @brief Checks to see if the sound is currently set to loop.
00148             /// @details Checks to see if the sound is currently set to loop.
00149             /// @return Returns whether or not the sound is currently set to loop.
00150             bool IsLooping();
00151             /// @brief Sets the position of the sound source.
00152             /// @details This function will set the position of the source to be used
00153             /// with the sound in 3D mode.
00154             /// @param Position The new position of the sound source.
00155             void SetPosition(Vector3 Position);
00156             /// @brief Sets the velocity of the sound source.
00157             /// @details This function will set the velocity of the source to be used
00158             /// with the sound in 3D mode.
00159             /// @param Velocity The new velocity of the sound source.
00160             void SetVelocity(Vector3 Velocity);
00161             /// @brief Sets the direction the sound source is facing.
00162             /// @details This function will set the direction the sound source is facing
00163             /// to be used with the sound in 3D mode.
00164             /// @param Direction The new direction of the sound source.
00165             void SetDirection(Vector3 Direction);
00166             /// @brief Sets the Rolloff factor used to attenuate the sound over a distance.
00167             /// @details This function will set how much the sound source will attenuate over
00168             /// a distance.  Larger values will make the sound attenuate faster/shorter distnaces,
00169             /// smaller values will make the sound carry better.
00170             /// @param Rolloff The factor at which the sound will attenuate.
00171             void SetRolloffFactor(Real Rolloff);
00172             /// @brief Sets the strength of the sound source.
00173             /// @details This function will set the strength of the sound, which will determine how well
00174             /// the sound from this sound source will carry over a distance.
00175             /// @param SoundStrength The strength of the sound.  Default: 1.0
00176             void SetStrength(Real SoundStrength);
00177             /// @brief Sets the distance from the sound source where attenuation will start.
00178             /// @details This function will set the distance from the sound source where attenuation
00179             /// effects will start being applied.
00180             /// @param MinDistance The distance at which attenuation effects start being applied.
00181             void SetMinDistance(Real MinDistance);
00182             /// @brief Sets the distance from the sound source where attenuation will stop.
00183             /// @details This function will set the distance from the sound source where attenuation
00184             /// effects will stop being applied.
00185             /// @param MaxDistance The distance at which attenuation effects stop being applied.
00186             void SetMaxDistance(Real MaxDistance);
00187             /// @brief Sets the pitch of the sound source.
00188             /// @details This function will set the pitch of the sound source.  Note: higher values
00189             /// will speed up the playback of the sound.  Default: 1.0
00190             /// @param Pitch The new pitch of the sound.
00191             void SetPitch(Real Pitch);
00192             /// @brief Sets the current volume of the sound source before effects.
00193             /// @details This function will set the current volume of the sound source before effects
00194             /// (like attenuation) are applied.
00195             /// @param Volume The current volume of the sound source to be applied.
00196             void SetVolume(Real Volume);
00197             /// @brief Sets the minimum volume the sound source can achieve.
00198             /// @details This function will set the minimum volume the sound source can achieve after
00199             /// effects(like attenuation) have been applied.
00200             /// @param MinVolume The minimum volume allowed for the sound source.
00201             void SetMinVolume(Real MinVolume);
00202             /// @brief Sets the maximum volume the sound source can achieve.
00203             /// @details This function will set the maximum volume the sound source can achieve after
00204             /// effects(like attenuation) have been applied.
00205             /// @param MaxVolume The maximum volume allowed for the sound source.
00206             void SetMaxVolume(Real MaxVolume);
00207             /// @brief Sets the inner cone angle of the sound source if you want the sound to be projected as a cone.
00208             /// @details This function will set the angle for the inner cone which the sound will be projected.  The
00209             /// cone will open up in the direction set by SetDirection().  Sounds are at their loudest only if the
00210             /// listener is within the inner cone.
00211             /// @param InnerAngle The angle of the inner cone.  Range is: 0.0 to 360.0.  Default: 360.0 (broadcast)
00212             void SetInnerConeAngle(Real InnerAngle);
00213             /// @brief Sets the outer cone angle of the sound source if you want the sound to be projected as a cone.
00214             /// @details This function will set the angle for the outer cone which the sound will be projected.  The
00215             /// cone will open up in the direction set by SetDirection().  Sounds connot be heard if the listener is
00216             /// outside the outer cone.
00217             /// @param OuterAngle The angle of the outer cone.  Range is: 0.0 to 360.0.  Default: 360.0 (broadcast)
00218             void SetOuterConeAngle(Real OuterAngle);
00219             /// @brief Sets how much the volume is scaled in the outer cone.
00220             /// @details This function will set how much the volume is scaled by for sounds in the outer
00221             /// cone of the sound source.
00222             /// @param OuterVolume The scale for volume for sounds in the outer cone.
00223             void SetOuterConeVolume(Real OuterVolume);
00224             /// @brief Sets the doppler strength, which impacts the doppler effect.
00225             /// @details This function will set the doppler strength of the sound source, which can
00226             /// enhance or diminish the doppler effect given off by this sound source.  Default: 1.0
00227             /// @param DopStr The doppler strength to be applied to this sound source.
00228             void SetDopplerStrength(Real DopStr);
00229             /// @brief Sets the doppler velocity vector.
00230             /// @details In most cases you shouldn't need to call this as this is handled by the engine.
00231             /// Is called every time position, velocity, or direction is altered.
00232             /// @param Velocity A vector3 representing the doppler velocity to be applied.
00233             void SetDopplerVelocity(Vector3 Velocity);
00234             /// @brief Moves the sound source.
00235             /// @details This function will set both the position and velocity of the sound source.
00236             /// @param Position The new position of the sound source.
00237             void Move(Vector3 Position);
00238             /// @brief Gets the objects position.
00239             /// @details Gets the objects current position.
00240             /// @return Returns the objects current position.
00241             Vector3 GetPosition();
00242             /// @brief Gets the objects velocity.
00243             /// @details Gets the objects current velocity.
00244             /// @return Returns the objects current velocity.
00245             Vector3 GetVelocity();
00246             /// @brief Gets the objects direction.
00247             /// @details Gets the objects current direction.
00248             /// @return Returns the objects current direction.
00249             Vector3 GetDirection();
00250             /// @brief Gets the Rolloff factor of the sound source.
00251             /// @details This function will get the factor used in attenuating the source over distance.
00252             /// @return Returns the factor used in attenuating the source over distance.
00253             Real GetRolloffFactor();
00254             /// @brief Gets the Strength of the sound source.
00255             /// @details This function will get the strength of the source, which determines how well
00256             /// the sound carries over a distance.
00257             /// @return Returns the strength of the source.
00258             Real GetStrength();
00259             /// @brief Gets the distance at which sound attenuation will start.
00260             /// @details This function will get the distance at which sound attenuation will start.
00261             /// @return Returns the distance from the source where attenuation will start.
00262             Real GetMinDistance();
00263             /// @brief Gets the distance at which sound attenuation will stop.
00264             /// @details This function will get the distance at which sound attenuation will stop.
00265             /// @return Returns the distance from the source where attenuation will stop.
00266             Real GetMaxDistance();
00267             /// @brief Gets the pitch of the sound source.
00268             /// @details This function will get the pitch of the sound source.
00269             /// @return Returns the pitch of the source.
00270             Real GetPitch();
00271             /// @brief Gets the current volume of the sound source.
00272             /// @details This function will get the current volume of the sound source before effects are applied.
00273             /// @return Returns the source volume before attenuation and other effects.
00274             Real GetVolume();
00275             /// @brief Gets the minimum volume of the sound source.
00276             /// @details This function will get the minimum volume the sound source can be attenuated to.
00277             /// @return Returns the minimum volume that the source can be attenuated to.
00278             Real GetMinVolume();
00279             /// @brief Gets the Maximum volume of the sound source.
00280             /// @details This function will get the maximum volume the sound source can achieve.
00281             /// @return Returns the maximum volume that the source can achieve.
00282             Real GetMaxVolume();
00283             /// @brief Gets the inner cone angle of the sound source.
00284             /// @details This function will get the inner cone angle of the sound source.  See SetInnerConeAngle().
00285             /// @return Returns the angle of the inner sound cone of the source.
00286             Real GetInnerConeAngle();
00287             /// @brief Gets the outer cone angle of the sound source.
00288             /// @details This function will get the outer cone angle of the sound source.  See SetOuterConeAngle().
00289             /// @return Returns the angle of the outer sound cone of the source.
00290             Real GetOuterConeAngle();
00291             /// @brief Gets the outer cone volume of the sound source.
00292             /// @details This function will get the outer cone volume of the sound source.  See SetOuterConeVolume().
00293             /// @return Returns how much the volume of the source is scaled in the outer cone.
00294             Real GetOuterConeVolume();
00295             /// @brief Gets the Doppler Strength of the sound.
00296             /// @details This function will get the doppler strength, which enhances or diminishes the doppler effect.
00297             /// @return Returns the doppler strength.
00298             Real GetDopplerStrength();
00299             /// @brief Gets the doppler velocity vector.
00300             /// @details This function will get the override for the doppler velocity vector.
00301             /// @return Returns the override for the doppler velocity vector.
00302             Vector3 GetDopplerVelocity();
00303     }; // sound
00304 }//phys
00305 
00306 #endif
